etymology.description: Pictogram; proposed depictions include a thumb (original of 拇/擘) or an acorn, with “white” from the acorn’s inside; unrelated to the top of 原.
etymology.interpretation: Most scholars treat it as a simple drawing, perhaps of a thumb or an acorn. If the acorn view is right, the sense “white” comes from the pale interior revealed when the shell is opened. Over time it generalized to the color and to notions of purity and clarity.

examples.chinese: 这件衣服很白(這件衣服很白)。
examples.english: This piece of clothing is very white.
